Posts.Content: Hello Bedford69 Good luck with your op .Could you please post a follow up when you are feeling up to it ? I am 18 months post op and have wondered whether to have a large flap of excess skin removed regards xx
Posts.Title: Dog ear revision surgery under local anaesthetic

Posts.Content: Hi Bedford69 Thank you for the update and I'm happy you got a good result .But really not good that you experienced pain through out the procedure .Not a great way to lose weight is it ? I get the feeling my blood pressure would have shot off the scale! Take it easy now xxxx Sorry about the type size !!!!!!
Posts.Title: Dog ear revision surgery under local anaesthetic

Posts.Content: It's a large bulge along and above/below the bra line, my bra cuts it in half ! It feels like I have a wodge of cotton wool under my arm. My surgeon told me I would be in line for reconstruction if I wanted. One year later I had revised my opinion and didn't want to , which was just as well as they had now decided that funding would need applying for ! As I have moved house since and been busy I haven't pursued it , it's going to be interesting to see what a different NHS trust comes up with   !
Posts.Title: Dog ear revision surgery under local anaesthetic

Posts.Content: Hi Jane Sorry to read about your pain & pins & needles . I am 6 mths post surgery left mast , I still have mild numbness and nerve pain in the left arm .Nothing like at the beginning when I was kept awake with it . I was prescribed Ametriptilene which is a mild anti depressant . However,  it is widely used for nerve pain after operations and I was assured I wouldn't get hooked on it . I didn't take it regularly just on the odd nights when I needed the sleep . Hope this helps , hugs x
Posts.Title: Pins and needles

Posts.Content: Hello Lennie You could try Bosom Buddies if they are in your area .I belonged to the Daventry group and now to North Devon ( Barnstaple) since I moved.They have given me a lot of support ,chat & laughs Good luck xxxx
Posts.Title: Coffee support groups

Posts.Content: Hello Raspo99 I don't think you are lazy at all , in fact you put me to shame ! I have been on a cruise & a three week trip to Sri Lanka in the year since I had a left Mx I certainly didn't take up valuable swimming cossy space with a box ! Neither do I wipe it every night , it's already in my bra twixt me & it .At the moment we are between homes so all our furniture etc.. is in store including "the box" ! Ordinarily I am very fussy in the home but there are limits and I believe getting my life back quickly is more important . Oh yes and I'd rather spend 5 minutes on anti wrinkle cream each night than on a boob ! Good luck & happy travelling xx
Posts.Title: Protheses problems?

Posts.Content: Hello Mistyblue , OMG ,what a " friend" to have . No wonder you were upset ,you were and are entitled to be. God forbid that she is ever in the same condition as us , it's not to be wished on our worst enemy. I'm only 4'10'' so I've learned to stand up for myself but that would have reduced me to tears too. I loved all the phrases to use in that situation but unfortunately none of us are ever that prepared are we. It's natural to worry about other health concerns and if you can't tell a friend then who can you ? I'm sure my friends have been bored rigid by my "what ifs" but they take another swig of Pino Grigio to keep them going . You hang in there and if she ever asks again ,look surprised and say you mistook her for someone who didn't care ! Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hello Jane, although I had bought a couple of mastectomy bras because I sew I thought I could do better. I have bought pretty bras and converted them . I found the instructions on the internet and they hold my prosthesis very well. I also feel tons better for not giving thieving bra manufacturers extra cash at our expense ! Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Pretty post mastectomy bras????

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone I haven't posted in awhile but I log in everyday to mentally cheer everyone on . I have my second bad UTI in ten months and wondered if anyone else has had the same . I recently moved house so I still need to convince my new GP that this isn't a basic cystitis .The last time I had a culture and it was resistant to all antibiotics bar two .I'm into the second day on antibios and so far don't feel any better .I want to give them a chance so won't go back guns blazing until I am sure. On the other hand I don't want it reaching my kidneys either . Hugs to all
Posts.Title: Letrozole and UTI

Posts.Content: Hello Carolyn How nice to have someone remember . The house move was manic due to two properties falling through due to legal reasons . Anyway ,we are now settled ( 4 months later ! ) in our new bungalow in NW Devon. It took a lot of fighting to get a landline too so I've been a bit shell shocked . That said anyone I've been in contact with here has been friendly ,I just need to tackle WI and bowls club now ! I called 111 yesterday (Sat ) at 8.30 & got an appt at North Devon hosp for 9.30. The practice nurse didn't take a culture but I got the feeling she wouldn't be surprised if she saw me back. That said for the last three hours I have felt a marked improvement so I will monitor it . I have my paperwork from last year in Sri Lanka & the meds I was given yesterday are resistant to last years infection ! Maybe it's different ,I can live in hopes .I've been drinking gallons, no coffee etc to the point yesterday when the sample I gave looked like spring water ! The "lump" from the last post that they "found " on Dec 22nd turned out on Jan  2nd to be scar tissue . I cannot blame them for being thorough , it was my own stupid fault for trying to fit it in before Christmas . The visit was only to say hello ,my GP was worried I'd slip under the radar ,bless her . Linda x
Posts.Title: Letrozole and UTI

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I've not been on for a couple of weeks , too many hospital & nurse visits which leave me shattered. I still have the seroma which got infected so I am now on antibiotics too. I have been referred back to the surgeon on Monday but that's another day. Right now I am more bothered about finding it difficult to do the exercises properly due to the tight scar/chest with the seroma .I was wondering if anyone had used a massager of any sort ? Has anyone found physio to be of any use ? Any other suggestions please ? Hugs to all xx
Posts.Title: Massage & exercise

Posts.Content: Hi Karen I hadn't thought of that , just checked on Dove & sure enough it's got alu in it , shower gel doesn't . I've made sure I don't use shampoo in the shower now just in case , even if it does "give extra strengh & body " . The mind boggles ! love Linda x
Posts.Title: Massage & exercise

Posts.Content: Thank you Karen & Clump,I will.xx
Posts.Title: Massage & exercise

Posts.Content: Thanks Karen , that's useful. I will ask him but I'm not holding my breath ! I'll push for it from the GP's end if the hospital won't help  ,love Linda x
Posts.Title: Massage & exercise

Posts.Content: I was both furious and then upset when I heard from an American professor  that getting cancer is my fault . Well thanks a lot for that , as if we don't have enough to contend with . I have never smoked , have a glass on the odd occasion and eat a healthy diet. I walk & garden . Never mind me though , what about all the children who very bravely live with cancer each day , is it their fault ? I don't think so and to put out a blanket statement is cruel to them and their parents.
Posts.Title: Cancer is our own fault

Posts.Content: Hello Bunty-Ann So sorry to read you have seroma problems , I know it's extremely uncomfortable .My experience was a seroma the size if yours wobbling about like a hot water bottle .I was worried in Tesco I'd get stopped for having a bottle under my coat ! Mine lasted for approximately 8 weeks with it being drained every 3 days including a trip to A & E over a weekend . I certainly didn't get bored . Eventually it got infected in spite of everyone's efforts so I was put on antibiotics . They swore blind it wasn't the drugs that dried it up but it was a big coincidence nevertheless ! Hang in there it does go away . My advice is to massage it well and often not allowing the skin to "stick" to your chest and do your exercises. Mine did stick and it now pulls when I raise my arm too high . Good luck & hugs xx
Posts.Title: Post Surgery Seroma Problems - Advice Please...

Posts.Content: Hello Ali Sorry to read your post . I have been on Letrezole for approx. 18 months with all the usual SE but thankfully most have gone . However , I had an eye test last May and was told I had the beginnings of cataracts in both eyes . I would ordinarily have a test every two years but in view of my position I'll be going back sooner . My vision has deteriorated a lot and like you I use my laptop/Kindle/phone and read avidly. I get double vision now later in the day when I'm tired . We have just moved house so it will be interesting to see what a different  test shows up. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Letrazole and cataracts

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone I visited the BCN last Friday for prosthesis fitting , that went well . I saw the physiotherapist yesterday and that was OK too. Expect both of them with no prompting from me said I might like to think about more surgery to correct the hard scars and "hole" at the sternum end . As I had a seroma for awhile my scars have stuck to the chest wall whilst healing. It's ugly & pulls all the time . Has anyone else experienced this please, I thought I'd finished with hospitals for a little while ! Hugs to all the ladies going through worse than me xx
Posts.Title: Scarring

Posts.Content: Hi Helen Thank you for your reply ,I know my query is minor compared to some . The point is I was going to raise the issue with BCN but she mentioned it first and as she has been a shrinking violet up until now it strengthened the comment . It's true I'm not in pain but all the scar is stuck to my chest which stops full movement and I have a 2" long and 1cm deep crevice at the armpit end , hard to clean & dry . I'm going to wait until Christmas is over and ask to see plastic surgeon. Happy Christmas xx
Posts.Title: Scarring

Posts.Content: Thank you , I think I know what I'm going to do but have to get presents & cards over first ! xx
Posts.Title: Scarring

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone We moved house about 4 weeks ago and they are a blur of boxes and B & Q ! My new GP thought it would be a good idea to have an appt at my new Breast Care Unit to say hello etc... I was diagnosed in August 2015 followed up by mastectomy. On Wednesday this week I got a call ,could I attend tomorrow as they had a cancellation. Off I went yesterday ( Thurs ) thinking I'd get the appt over and then nip off to the supermarket etc.. Wrong . I met the consultant ,answered all relevant questions and then had an exam of scar side & spare boob. He said  " Was that lump always there ? " The world stopped . I cannot feel the lump . He called in senior colleague who said after examination that they couldn't do a scan that day but I now have an appt for Jan 2nd. They both said not to worry ( I think I heard that before somewhere !) My response was that they were making me wait over Christmas and New Year , they even wished me "Happy Christmas" on my way out ! My husband says I should be pleased/grateful that they are doing their job infinitely better than the last NHS trust . Am I odd to feel so angry that they've turned my life upside down just when we were thinking that 2017 would be our year to get on with retirement ? Sorry about the rant , I haven't had time to make any friends yet and anyway I wouldn't want to tell them.
Posts.Title: Ever so slightly stunned ! Please not again.

Posts.Content: Hello Lynn I was really having a rant at me being ultra efficient and taking the cancellation  instead of leaving it until January ! It wasn't scheduled , just a meet and greet after my house move . I am very impressed with their kindness and not leaving anything to chance .My old NHS Trust were not kind and I had to shout for an ultrasound / mammo on the remaining booby . Not something I like doing at the best of times . Merry Christmas and best wishes for 2017 with whatever it throws at us xx
Posts.Title: Ever so slightly stunned ! Please not again.

Posts.Content: Hi Julia Thank you for replying. Yes ,of course I understand all you have said and I am /will be so grateful to all  if this turns out to be a re-occurrence. My rant was at the horrible sequence of "what if's" . If I hadn't been able to take the cancellation I would have been in blissful ignorance for a couple of weeks .We have had the most horrendous three months with nothing to do with cancer so in my innocence I thought I could try to put it behind me . Hey ho Have a lovely Christmas xx
Posts.Title: Ever so slightly stunned ! Please not again.

Posts.Content: Hello Teresa I'm sorry to read you are in a similar rubbish situation .I'm calming down now and being realistic ,I'll go with the flow as I can't change it . I'm still hoping 2017 will be a good year one way or the other . I do feel for all our relations though who sometimes aren't as stoical as us . Have as good a Christmas as you can and all the luck for a very happy New year Linda xx
Posts.Title: Ever so slightly stunned ! Please not again.

Posts.Content: Hello Lou When my BCN fitted me with mine a year ago she tried at least ten and my head was spinning ! She told me if ever I lost ( fat chance ! )/gained weight or it got damaged in any way they would change it . I would try the NHS first . Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Buying a prosthetic breast on line.

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite I read your reply and had to answer . I've been on Letrezole for 15 months , Methotrexate for arthritis for 8 weeks . I felt like a little old lady ad had lost my get up and go . I know I have OA but I also know the Letrezole has crippled me at times .I've also been told I had fibromyalgia too but I think "they" are clutching at straws . Three weeks ago I felt so low I was beginning to wonder if it was all worth it . I mentioned this to a random GP over the phone who probably freaked out ! He put me on 1000mg naproxen daily and the next day I had my life back ,mentally and physically. It's a bit harsh on my stomach but I was told to take Omeprazole twice daily . I also find now I don't always need the full dose . If only I'd been given this two years ago ! Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Calcium in breast

Posts.Content: I had a left mastectomy and node biopsy, results on Fri 16th hence the reason I think I might be in for second op to remove them. Why things can't be done in better order God only knows ! Good luck with your op.  The burning is tolerable early in the morning but having to have the wound drained every few days doesn't help, I slosh like a hotwater bottle ! By 6 pm I long for bed !
Posts.Title: burning

Posts.Content: Hi.Has anyone else experienced extreme burning pain underarm and armpit after mastectomy? My operation was 12 days ago and this pain is getting worse. I can't bear anything to touch it .
Posts.Title: burning

Posts.Content: You are all so kind to reply , it makes such a difference not to be alone. I did have SLNB ,with radioactive injection an hour prior to the op.Was told this was to pinpoint nodes for biopsy though, not removal. Anyway , I'll know soon and can then focus on getting that sorted.  thanks again L
Posts.Title: burning

Posts.Content: Hello Gallus Sorry to read you have nerve pain .After I had a mastectomy in Sept 2015 I had chronic pain in my left arm , so bad nothing touched it . Agony to wear clothes and moving made it worse . I regularly visited this forum and someone suggested that I ask by name for Amytriptylene. It worked and I slept really well too . The pain eased off but for the last few days has returned , obviously as I get feeling back in certain areas . I took one last night and the pain has eased again . Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Chronic nerve pain

Posts.Content: Thanks j ,I haven't had node removal though it could be on the cards .I dread that more than anything.
Posts.Title: burning
